oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Marriage
York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; York, Gracie Loretta Williams, 1900-1984
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Newspaper article entitled "York Married to Miss Williams" by Robert G. Fields (staff correspondent). "Miss Williams, who is the youngest of thirteen children was attended by three maids of honor, Misses Ida Wright, Maud Brier, and Adella Darwin, while the groom's best man was a comrade in arms, Sergt. Henry Clay Brier, U. S. A."

The marriage ceremony was performed beneath a large beech tree by Tennessee Governor Albert H. Roberts in Pall Mall on June 7, 1919, before two thousand people. Gov. Roberts and Maj. E. B. Stahlman, owner and publisher of the Nashville Banner, delivered the principal addresses. The Fentress County sheriff, under strict orders from Gov. Roberts, prohibited any filming of the ceremony.
